title: Feeling Cheated..
body:
I feel rather cheated/scammed. I bought 3 boxes with keys and got 3 different skins. Bilgewater Swain, Snow Day Bard, and Scorched Earth Renekton. Neither of these skins interested me so I rerolled them into a random skin. What the outcome was really surprised me, it was ANOTHER  Scorched Earth Renekton..

According to the ingame tooltip the reroll feature SUPPOSED to give you a random item of same type that you do not own. I feel as if this is a bug and misinformed.

replies.body: In this case you received a permanent version Scorched Earth Renekton, not the shard that you used to reroll it.  The system is random, so it will give you a skin for any champion.  More details are also available in the [hextech crafting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide).  Best of luck in your future rolls!
Ive gotten skins for champs i don't have unlocked :(

This is false information. The skin I received is of a champion I do not even own. The system seems to be flawed and bugged on this behalf of using it.
Fixed!  My bad, as a correction you can get a skin for any champion even if you don't own it.  Thanks friends!

I checked the article you linked, but I can't find any detailed explanation for what you get with re-rolls... Please correct/complete if I'm wrong.

* If I re-roll 3 champion shards, I get a champion permanent, guaranteed to be for a champ i don't own and automatically redeemed (unless I already own all champs). I can't keep the permanent into my inventory.
* If I re-roll 3 skin shards, I get a skin permanent that I don't already own, but potentially for a champ I don't own. If I don't own the champ, the permanent remains in my inventory.
* There is no influence of the shards used over the permanent obtained. Re-rolling 3 Legacy or 3 Epic shards won't guarantee anything better than re-rolling 3 cheap and common shards.
